text: ਨਿੰਦਕ ਕਾ ਕਹਿਆ ਕੋਇ ਨ ਮਾਨੈ ॥

translation.text: No one belives what the slanderer says.

transliteration.text: nindak kā kahiā kōi n mānai .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The slanderer tells lies, and later regrets and repents.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

translation.text: He wrings his hands, and hits his head against the ground.

translation.text: The Lord's slave does not wish anyone ill.

text: ਮਨ ਕੇ ਬਿਕਾਰ ਮਿਟਹਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਸਿਮਰਤ ਜਨਮ ਜਨਮ ਕੀ ਮੈਲੁ ਹਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Remembering God in meditation, the mind's corruption is eradicated, and the filth of countless incarnations is washed away. ||1||Pause||

author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: Nanak meditates continually on the Lord's Lotus Feet. ||4||42||55||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

translation.text: Bhairao, Fifth Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: The True Guru has listened to my prayer.

translation.text: All my affairs have been resolved.

translation.text: Deep within my mind and body, I meditate on God.

translation.text: The Perfect Guru has dispelled all my fears. ||1||

translation.text: The All-powerful Divine Guru is the Greatest of all.

text: ਸਭਿ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਈ ਤਿਸ ਕੀ ਸੇਵ ॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Serving Him, I obtain all comforts. ||Pause||

transliteration.text: sabh sukh pāī tis kī sēv . rahāu .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

text: ਜਾ ਕਾ ਕੀਆ ਸਭੁ ਕਿਛੁ ਹੋਇ ॥

translation.text: Everything is done by Him.

transliteration.text: jā kā kīā sabh kish hōi .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. text: ਤਿਸ ਕਾ ਅਮਰੁ ਨ ਮੇਟੈ ਕੋਇ ॥

translation.text: No one can erase His Eternal Decree.

transliteration.text: tis kā amar n mētai kōi .

translation.text: The Supreme Lord God, the Transcendent Lord, is incomparably beautiful.

text: ਸਫਲ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਤਿਸ ਕਾ ਰੂਪੁ ॥੨॥

translation.text: The Guru is the Image of Fulfillment, the Embodiment of the Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: saphal mūrat gur tis kā rūp .2.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. text: ਜਾ ਕੈ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਬਸੈ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ॥

translation.text: The Name of the Lord abides deep within him.

transliteration.text: jā kai antar basai har nām .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. text: ਜੋ ਜੋ ਪੇਖੈ ਸੁ ਬ੍ਰਹਮ ਗਿਆਨੁ ॥

translation.text: Wherever he looks, he sees the Wisdom of God.

transliteration.text: jō jō pēkhai s braham giān .

text: ਬੀਸ ਬਿਸੁਏ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਮਨਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੁ ॥

translation.text: His mind is totally enlightened and illuminated.

transliteration.text: bīs bisuē jā kai man paragās .

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਜਨ ਕੈ ਪਾਰਬ੍ਰਹਮ ਕਾ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Within that person, the Supreme Lord God abides. ||3||

transliteration.text: tis jan kai pārabraham kā nivās .3.

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਗੁਰ ਕਉ ਸਦ ਕਰੀ ਨਮਸਕਾਰ ॥

translation.text: I humbly bow to that Guru forever.

transliteration.text: tis gur kau sad karī namasakār .

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਗੁਰ ਕਉ ਸਦ ਜਾਉ ਬਲਿਹਾਰ ॥

translation.text: I am forever a sacrifice to that Guru.

transliteration.text: tis gur kau sad jāu balihār .

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਕੇ ਚਰਨ ਧੋਇ ਧੋਇ ਪੀਵਾ ॥

translation.text: I wash the feet of the Guru, and drink in this water.

transliteration.text: satigur kē charan dhōi dhōi pīvā .

text: ਗੁਰ ਨਾਨਕ ਜਪਿ ਜਪਿ ਸਦ ਜੀਵਾ ॥੪॥੪੩॥੫੬॥

translation.text: Chanting and meditating forever on Guru Nanak, I live. ||4||43||56||

transliteration.text: gur nānak jap jap sad jīvā .4.43.56.
